CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Significant progress has been made in synthesis of conjugated polymers and their applications for optoelectronic device such as organic light - emitting diodes ( OLEDs ) , organic photovoltaic cells ( OPVs ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) since Heeger , MacDiarmid , and Shirakawa discovered conducting polymers in 1976.^1 As a result of the low - cost , light - weight , and flexibility advantages , optoelectronic devices based on conjugated polymers are a promising cost - effective alternative to inorganic materials - based microelectronics. Conjugated polymers can be classified as hole ( p - type ) or electron ( n - type ) transporting materials according to the type of orderly transferring charge carriers. Most of conjugated polymers are p - type semiconductors that have seen a dramatic rise in performance over the past decade while much less attention has been devoted to n - type semiconducting polymers that have lagged behind their p - type counterparts. 2 Organic n - type materials are essential for the fabrication of organic p-n junctions , OPVs , n-channel OFETs , OLEDs , and complementary logic circuits. 3 The n - type building blocks are the core components in n - type semiconducting polymers. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides are one of the classical n - type building blocks and can exhibit relatively high electron affinities , high electron mobilities , and excellent chemical , thermal , and photochemical stabilities. 4 These materials are electron deficient due to the substitution of an aromatic core with one or two sets of π-accepting imide groups that are mutually conjugated. The widely used rylene diimides include perylene diimides ( PDIs , 1 ) and naphthalene diimides ( NDIs , 2 ) ( Figure 1 ). Zhan and co-workers reported the synthesis of the first soluble rylene-based fully conjugated polymer. 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air. 6 Moreover , all - polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 1.5% ( AM1.5 , 100 mW cm^-2 ). 7-9 Facchetti et al. reported a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene ; 10 OFET devices based on this polymer fabricated in a top-gate , bottom - contact configuration with polymeric dielectrics exhibited μ e of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions with I on / I off > 10^5 . 11 The simplest aromatic imide system is phthalimide ( 3 ) and thiophene imide ( 4 ) ( Figure 1 ). A few literatures reported phthalimide - containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s , 12 a polyaniline derivative , 13 and a polythiophene derivative.

Let's think step by step.

1. Conjugated polymers
2. Rylene diimides (PDIs and NDIs)
3. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
4. Phthalimide
5. Thiophene imide
6. Polythiophene derivative
7. Poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s
8. Polyaniline derivative

These are the "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Conjugated polymers
2. Rylene diimides (PDIs and NDIs)
3. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
4. Phthalimide
5. Thiophene imide
6. Polythiophene derivative

These are the Material Name entities that are clearly referred to in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Conjugated polymers |
| Rylene diimides (PDIs and NDIs) |
| PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer |
| Phthalimide |
| Thiophene imide |
| Polythiophene derivative |

Paragraph: Significant progress has been made in synthesis of conjugated polymers and their applications for optoelectronic device such as organic light - emitting diodes ( OLEDs ) , organic photovoltaic cells ( OPVs ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) since Heeger , MacDiarmid , and Shirakawa discovered conducting polymers in 1976.^1 As a result of the low - cost , light - weight , and flexibility advantages , optoelectronic devices based on conjugated polymers are a promising cost - effective alternative to inorganic materials - based microelectronics. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides are one of the classical n - type building blocks and can exhibit relatively high electron affinities , high electron mobilities , and excellent chemical , thermal , and photochemical stabilities. 4 These materials are electron deficient due to the substitution of an aromatic core with one or two sets of π-accepting imide groups that are mutually conjugated. A few literatures reported phthalimide - containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s , 12 a polyaniline derivative , 13 and a polythiophene derivative.

2. p-type transporting materials
3. n-type transporting materials

5. naphthalene diimides (NDIs)
6. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
7. polythiophene derivative donors
8. phthalimide
9. thiophene imide
10. conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene
11. polymeric dielectrics
12. poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s
13. polyaniline derivative

4. naphthalene diimides (NDIs)
5. PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer
6. phthalimide

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Significant progress has been made in synthesis of conjugated polymers and their applications for optoelectronic device such as organic light - emitting diodes ( OLEDs ) , organic photovoltaic cells ( OPVs ) , and organic field - effect transistors ( OFETs ) since Heeger , MacDiarmid , and Shirakawa discovered conducting polymers in 1976.^1 As a result of the low - cost , light - weight , and flexibility advantages , optoelectronic devices based on conjugated polymers are a promising cost - effective alternative to inorganic materials - based microelectronics. Conjugated polymers can be classified as hole ( p - type ) or electron ( n - type ) transporting materials according to the type of orderly transferring charge carriers. Most of conjugated polymers are p - type semiconductors that have seen a dramatic rise in performance over the past decade while much less attention has been devoted to n - type semiconducting polymers that have lagged behind their p - type counterparts. 2 Organic n - type materials are essential for the fabrication of organic p-n junctions , OPVs , n-channel OFETs , OLEDs , and complementary logic circuits. 3 The n - type building blocks are the core components in n - type semiconducting polymers. Aromatic imides such as rylene diimides are one of the classical n - type building blocks and can exhibit relatively high electron affinities , high electron mobilities , and excellent chemical , thermal , and photochemical stabilities. 4 These materials are electron deficient due to the substitution of an aromatic core with one or two sets of π-accepting imide groups that are mutually conjugated. The widely used rylene diimides include perylene diimides ( PDIs , 1 ) and naphthalene diimides ( NDIs , 2 ) ( Figure 1 ). Zhan and co-workers reported the synthesis of the first soluble rylene-based fully conjugated polymer. 5 Top-gate OFETs based on this PDI- dithienothiophene copolymer exhibited a saturation electron mobility ( μ e ) of 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 , current on / off ratio ( I on / I off ) of 10^4 , and a low threshold voltage ( V th ) of 7 V in air. 6 Moreover , all - polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors exhibited power conversion efficiencies ( PCEs ) as high as 1.5% ( AM1.5 , 100 mW cm^-2 ). 7-9 Facchetti et al. reported a conjugated copolymer of NDI and bithiophene ; 10 OFET devices based on this polymer fabricated in a top-gate , bottom - contact configuration with polymeric dielectrics exhibited μ e of 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 under ambient conditions with I on / I off > 10^5 . 11 The simplest aromatic imide system is phthalimide ( 3 ) and thiophene imide ( 4 ) ( Figure 1 ). A few literatures reported phthalimide - containing conjugated polymers such as poly-(phenylene ethynylene)s , 12 a polyaniline derivative , 13 and a polythiophene derivative.

Let's think step by step.

1. p-type semiconductors: These are conjugated polymers that transfer hole charge carriers. No specific value is mentioned.
2. n-type semiconducting polymers: These are conjugated polymers that transfer electron charge carriers. No specific value is mentioned.
3. saturation electron mobility (μe) of PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer in top-gate OFETs: 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. current on / off ratio (I on / I off) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer: 10^4
5. threshold voltage (Vth) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer: 7 V
6. power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of all-polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors: as high as 1.5% (AM1.5, 100 mW cm^-2)
7. μe of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer: 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions)
8. I on / I off of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer: > 10^5
9. Phthalimide and thiophene imide: These are aromatic imides mentioned in the text, but no specific values are given for them.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. saturation electron mobility (μe) of PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer in top-gate OFETs: 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
2. current on / off ratio (I on / I off) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer: 10^4
3. threshold voltage (Vth) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer: 7 V
4. power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of all-polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors: 1.5% (AM1.5, 100 mW cm^-2)
5. μe of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer: 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 (under ambient conditions)
6. I on / I off of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer: > 10^5

These are the material properties mentioned in the text with specific values.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property          | Value                                                                 |
|------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Saturation electron mobility (μe) of PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer in top-gate OFETs | 6 x 10^-2 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1                                          |
| Current on / off ratio (I on / I off) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer | 10^4                                                             |
| Threshold voltage (Vth) of top-gate OFETs based on PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer | 7 V                                                              |
| Power conversion efficiencies (PCEs) of all-polymer solar cells based on blends of polythiophene derivative donors and PDI-dithienothiophene copolymer acceptors | 1.5% (AM1.5, 100 mW cm^-2)                                     |
| μe of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer (under ambient conditions) | 0.1-0.85 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1                                          |
| I on / off of OFET devices based on NDI-bithiophene copolymer | > 10^5                                                           |
